qas.question: How many passengers does the most dense rail network in Europe carry annualy?
In 2007, what was the average amount of km's travelled by eacg Swiss citizens on the rails?
Who mainly administers the Swiss railway system?
What is the Alp-Transit project designed to reduce the time of travel between?
Under which mountains are the railway tunnels being built for the Alp-Transit project?

context: The most dense rail network in Europe of 5,063 km (3,146 mi) carries <a0_0>over 350 million<a0_0/> passengers annually. In 2007, each Swiss citizen travelled on average <a1_0>2,258<a1_0/> km (1,403 mi) by rail, which makes them the keenest rail users. The network is administered mainly by the <a2_0>Federal Railways<a2_0/>, except in Graubünden, where the 366 km (227 mi) narrow gauge railway is operated by the Rhaetian Railways and includes some World Heritage lines. The building of new railway base tunnels through <a4_0>the Alps<a4_0/> is under way to reduce the time of travel between <a3_0>north and south<a3_0/> through the AlpTransit project.
